data.approach: Investigate PostCSS parsing error where JavaScript import statements are being parsed as CSS - likely a malformed script tag or missing closing tag in the source file

summary: PostCSS error was caused by corrupted Vite/SvelteKit cache
Cleaned cache by removing .svelte-kit and node_modules/.vite directories
Full production build now succeeds without errors
Dev server works (port 3333 is in use by existing IDE instance)
findings: The error showed import statements being parsed as CSS - a cache corruption symptom
File structure was correct (script tag lines 1-304, style tag line 513+)
rm -rf .svelte-kit node_modules/.vite && npm run build succeeds
recommendedActions: Close this task - issue was cache corruption, now resolved

summary: Identified PostCSS parsing error in Svelte route file
Discovered issue with import statement in source file

quality.preExisting: PostCSS configuration may have compatibility issues

suggestedTasks.title: Resolve PostCSS Configuration Conflict in Svelte Project
suggestedTasks.description: Investigate and resolve the PostCSS parsing error occurring in Svelte route files. Check Vite and PostCSS plugin configurations to ensure proper CSS module handling. Verify import statements and build configuration are compatible across different route components.
suggestedTasks.reason: Critical build blocking error preventing project compilation

suggestedTasks.title: Audit Svelte Route Import Statements and CSS Processing
suggestedTasks.description: Conduct a comprehensive review of import statements across Svelte route files to ensure consistent and correct module imports. Verify that Vite, PostCSS, and Svelte configurations are aligned and not causing unexpected parsing errors.
suggestedTasks.reason: Potential systemic configuration issue across project routes

patterns: Careful management of Svelte route imports
gotchas: PostCSS parser can be sensitive to import statements
Vite build process may have unexpected CSS module handling

documentationNeeds: Document PostCSS and Vite integration notes
